application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View, CA, USA; Boulder, CO, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA
description:
Our PeopleDev team works hard to ensure every Googler has access to the resources they need to become their best personal and professional selves. We leverage tools, technology, and innovative formats to scale learning and support Googlers at all stages of their careers — from Noogler Orientation, to manager training, to leadership development, and more. We have four key beliefs about learning — that it is personal, social, a process, and happens in real life — and we infuse these beliefs throughout the wide array of learning and development opportunities at Google. As a PeopleDev team member, you'll always be thinking about new ways to help others grow, and you share a passion for empowering Googlers to unlock their full potential.

As a Space and Demand Planning Manager for the Resource Operations team, you will be responsible for evaluating PeopleDev’s space needs and leading the planning and optimization processes across our global team to ensure that our space needs align with our strategic goals. You will help the team prioritize needs and work with critical Google stakeholders and partners to find solutions for space challenges to support successful business operations. Additionally, you will ensure PeopleDev has the information they need to make decisions to move the organization forward.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in space planning, real estate, strategy consulting, business operations, finance, or program management.
  • Experience with spreadsheet software and sharing insights with stakeholders.
  • Experience in project management, defining and executing projects within timelines and managing multiple stakeholders.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience building and presenting business cases.
  • Ability to synthesize information and see the big picture while effectively managing details.
  • Ability to deliver projects within timelines and budgets.
  • Ability to prioritize effectively across competing priorities.
  • Effective personal and professional credibility, responsiveness, business focus, integrity, and sound judgment.
  • Excellent data analysis and problem-solving skills.
responsibilities:
• Design a 3 to 5 year strategy for PeopleDev’s space needs. Support development of initiatives to implement spaces for PeopleDev’s future space needs, influencing key business decisions.
  • Determine PeopleDev’s own space utilization requirements and optimize resource management of space, as well as PeopleDev’s space needs in relation to and in consideration of People Operation's overall space requirements (e.g., HR benefits, staffing).
  • Develop short and long-term supply and demand models that seek to help minimize total costs, while maintaining service levels to PeopleDev partners and various product area customers worldwide. Conduct and develop financial analyses and/or business cases as needed (e.g., cost/benefit analyses for on/off campus program management).
  • Lead capacity management requirement definition and optimization studies, and utilize modeling to address scaling challenges. Manage the maintenance of the PeopleDev rooms globally and help identify root causes for the largest drivers of forecast and capacity/planning variances.
title: Space and Demand Planning Manager
